module.name: Text To Speech

description.p: Creates and manages Text to Speech recordings which can be used as an interim destination (i.e. speak text then jump to another destination), can be configured to jump back to an IVR, or can be added as system recordings.

Multiple speech synthesis engines are supported, including:
Cepstral SWIFT (Can be configured to use app_swift if your license doesn't support writing to a file))
Google Translation
Microsoft Translation (Requires subscription from Azure Marketplace)
eSpeak
Festival Flite
Festival Text2Wave

Multiple text sources are supported, including
Static Text
A text file
Output from a shell command
A URL (Can be configured to strip HTML tags)

module.changelog: *2.0.0.0 - 2012-04-24 - Paul White (pwhite@hiddenmatrix.org)* - Major overhaul of entire module. Almost all code was rewritten. - Engines are now modular, making it very easy to add new ones. - Implement engines: google, microsoft, swift, espeak, flite, text2wave - Implemented new modular source system, making it very easy to add new sources. - Implemented sources: text, command, file, URL - Added dynamic options where applicable - Added new 'Allow Playback Control'
